page.title: 01STAMFORD-HISTORY
page.content: Stamford is a very old town. There has been a type of town or village as far back as the Roman Invasion. It is in the county of Lincolnshire in the district of South Kesteven. Stamford has a population of approximately 17,000. It has a newspaper, published every friday, which is the oldest provincial weekly newspaper in England. Stamford has been described as one of the most interesting towns in England. Some of its features are: Browne's hospital, which is in Broad street and was built in 1475, Burghley House, which was built in 1565 and is owned by the Cecil family, Daniel Lamberts grave in St Martins churchyard, and many churches. Stamford also has an ancient market in Broad Street and Ironmonger street on Fridays.
